div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, May 28, 1923. BAKER BOSSES SIGN AGREEMENT WITH UNIONYield to All Demands of Workers

body.p: Yesterday afternoon the baker bosses signed an agreement with the union of Jewish bakers.

All demands of the union, such as an increase in wages of six dollars a week for first-class workers and three dollars a week for second-class workers, extra pay for overtime, and pay for Jewish and legal holidays were granted by the baker bosses.
The old agreement expired at 12 o'clock midnight and the new agreement is already in force.
